description._content: ID: 006366 Title: Trial of Marshal Ney for high treason Author: "Ney, Michel (Michel Ney)" Illustrator: "Kennerly, J (J Kennerly)" Provenance: E. Cox & Son, London , 1816. Caption: Marshal Ney Notes: Michel Ney ( 1769 - 1815 ), Prince of Moskwa. French Napoleonic General and Marshal. Known as the Bravest of the Brave. After fighting for Napoleon at the Battle of Waterloo, he was condemned for high treason and shot by firing squad. Image taken from Trial of Marshal Ney for high treason taken in short-hand at the time of trial. Originally published/produced in E. Cox & Son, London , 1816. Source identifier: 10666.aa.35, frontispiece British Library Shelfmark: 10666.aa.35 If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of this image, please place an order at Images Online imagesonline.bl.uk. The details from the above list should help you locate the images.
